name: Arundhati Roy
title: Author of 'The God of Small Things'
description: Arundhati Roy is a renowned Indian author and activist. Her debut novel won the Man Booker Prize in 1997.

name: Jhumpa Lahiri
title: Pulitzer Prize-Winning Author
description: An Indian-American author, Jhumpa Lahiri is known for her works like 'The Interpreter of Maladies' and 'The Namesake.'

name: Salman Rushdie
title: Author of 'Midnight's Children'
description: Salman Rushdie is a British-Indian novelist whose works often blend magical realism with historical fiction.

name: Kazi Nazrul Islam
title: The Rebel Poet of Bengal
description: Known as the 'Bidrohi Kobi' (Rebel Poet), Kazi Nazrul Islam was a Bengali poet, writer, and musician, celebrated for his fiery revolutionary works.

name: Sarat Chandra Chattopadhyay
title: Author of 'Srikanto' and 'Devdas'
description: Sarat Chandra Chattopadhyay, a Bengali novelist and short story writer, is renowned for his depictions of rural Bengal and human emotions.

name: Anita Desai
title: Three-Time Booker Prize Finalist
description: Anita Desai is an Indian novelist recognized for her deep insights into Indian culture and family dynamics.
